t: Job 16
Then*p Job answered and said,
I*p have heard many such things: miserable comforters are ye all.
Shall*p vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?
I*p also could speak as ye do: if your soul were in my soul's stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.
But*p I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should assuage your grief.
Though*p I speak, my grief is not assuaged: and though I forbear, what am I eased?
But*p now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.
And*p thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.
He*p teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.
They*p have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.
God*p hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.
I*p was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.
His*p archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.
He*p breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.
I*p have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.
My*p face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;
Not*p for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.
O*p earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.
Also*p now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.
My*p friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.
O*p that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbour!
When*p a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
